DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to represent the overall disease response in a target, non-target, or new lesion using the irRECIST criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information relating to the overall lesion response.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Including everything.:(LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredDefinition: Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Concepts.definition: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Property.changeDescription: Denise Warzel updated Definition by seraching NCI Thesaurus in Admin tool.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: irRECIST: Immune-related Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST)-2013
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/7/18 jk added irRECIST CSI.  8/30/17 tt transferred context, added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A set of criteria for capturing the unidimensional measurements which are used to assess the effect of immunotherapeutic agents on solid tumors. These criteria are based on elements of the Immune-Related Response Criteria (irRC) and Immune-related RECIST (irRECIST)._Including everything._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A complete disappearance of  all measurable and non-measurable lesions. Lymph nodes must decrease to less than 10 mm in short axis. Confirmation of response is not mandatory.

Concepts.definition: A complete disappearance of all measurable and non-measurable lesions. Lymph nodes must decrease to < 10 mm in short axis. Confirmation of response is not mandatory.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A decrease of greater than or equal to 30% in TMTB relative to baseline, non-target lesions are irNN, and no unequivocal progression of new non-measurable lesions

Concepts.definition: A decrease of 30% or more in TMTB relative to baseline, non-target lesions are irNN, and no unequivocal progression of new non-measurable lesions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minimum 20% increase and minimum 5 mm absolute increase in total measured tumor burden compared to nadir, or irPD for non-target or new non-measurable lesions. Confirmation of progression is recommended minimum 4 weeks after the first irPD assessment.

Concepts.definition: A minimum 20% increase and minimum 5 mm absolute increase in total measured tumor burden compared to nadir, or irPD for non-target or new non-measurable lesions. Confirmation of progression is recommended minimum 4 weeks after the first irPD assessment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A failure to meet criteria for irCR or irPR in the absence of irPD.

Concepts.definition: A failure to meet criteria for irCR or irPR in the absence of irPD.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Used in exceptional cases where insufficient data exists.

Concepts.definition: Used in exceptional cases where insufficient data exists.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Used in adjuvant setting when no disease is detected.

Concepts.definition: Used in adjuvant setting when no disease is detected.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No target disease was identified at baseline and at follow-up the patient fails to meet criteria for irCR or irPD.

Concepts.definition: No target disease was identified at baseline and at follow-up the patient fails to meet criteria for irCR or irPD.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Immune-related Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors Overall Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A set of criteria for capturing the unidimensional measurements which are used to assess the effect of immunotherapeutic agents on solid tumors. These criteria are based on elements of the Immune-Related Response Criteria (irRC) and Immune-related RECIST (irRECIST).:Including everything.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A set of criteria for capturing the unidimensional measurements which are used to assess the effect of immunotherapeutic agents on solid tumors based on elements of Immune-related RECIST (irRECIST).
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

DataElement.changeDescription: 10/7/18 jk Changed registration status to "Standard" per Fall 2018 Content Team review.  10/17/17 jk updated short name and pref question text for consistency with RECISTv1.1 Standard CDE.  10/11/17 LS created based on irRECIST guideline.
